node.title: Wool packager gets funding to process in Australia
node.alt: Photo of wool being held up
node.description: The trend towards more meat sheep breeds in Australia is creating new opportunities for coarse, low value wool that might otherwise end up in landfill.
node.content:
["The trend towards more meat sheep breeds in Australia is creating new opportunities for coarse, low value wool that might otherwise end up in landfill.", "Sydney-based Planet Protector Packaging has won almost $5 million in a federal government manufacturing grant to build the nation's first processing facility geared for wool that is unsuitable for clothing.", "Chief Executive Officer Joanne Howarth said supply chain disruptions and freight increases made processing offshore in China unviable.", "\"Twenty years ago when it went to China, there were no environmental regulations, labour was very cheap, and it was easy. It was a quick solution to offshore things. That's changed now,\" she said.", "\"China has got a lot of increased regulations and the mills that we're working with, in fact, have power restrictions, and they can only trade for six hours a day.\"", "
Alternative packaging
", "The company makes woollen felt packaging as an alternative to plastics and polystyrene.", "", "
The\u00a0low grade wool is compressed and turned\u00a0into woollen felt packaging.(Landline)
", "It is servicing a growing demand for sustainable insulation of perishable goods such as meat, seafood, and medicines.", "\"I think credit to the government that finally people are listening, that we need to get our sovereign manufacturing capability back here,\" Ms Howarth said.", "", "
Joanne Howarth's company has received a manufacturing grant to build a processing facility for coarse wool.(Supplied)
", "The company hoped to raise an additional $5 to $6 million in crowdfunding next year to build a facility to clean and process coarse wool for the packaging as well as a range of other products.", "
Liquid wool fertiliser
", "One of their new customers could be a Perth-based start up that has pioneered a process to solubilise wool into liquid amino acids.", "Chemist inventor Ramiz Boulos said amino acids were widely used in food supplements, pharmaceuticals, and cosmetics.", "", "
Ramiz Boulos hopes his discoveries will help repay Australia for his higher education and a life of freedom.(ABC: Robert Koenig-Luck)
", "His company Veritan is already marketing a liquid fertiliser made from wool, which would soon be independently trialled on broadacre crops such as wheat and barley.", "", "
Wool is solubilised into liquid amino acids.\u00a0(ABC: Robert Koenig-Luck)
", "", "
Mr Boulos turns low grade wool into liquid fertiliser.(Supplied)
", "\"However, we are still in the early days of really scaling up our manufacturing and bringing in economies of scale and really seeing if we can match the price of other products,\" he said.", "The company was planning to list on the Australian Stock Exchange before year's end to raise up to $500,000 to expand into the manufacture of other products, including a plastics alternative made from wool.", "He recently resigned from the board of a company he formed in 2014 to develop a new type of antibiotic he discovered, which is in development as a treatment to a common \"superbug\" known as Clostridium Difficile, which causes millions of infections globally every year.\u00a0", "He remains a 35 per cent shareholder of Boulos and Cooper, which has proven in animal trials that its drug can kill the dangerous gut bug. He now wants\u00a0to focus on wool based amino acids.", "
Calling Australia home
", "Dr Boulos fled the civil war in Sudan as a 16-year-old in 1999 and was granted humanitarian refugee status by the Australian government.", "His family had lived in Sudan since the late 19th century, but as ethnic Egyptian Coptic Christians, they faced persecution when Sudan adopted Sharia law.", "", "
Ramiz Boulos (pictured) and his family\u00a0lived in Sudan\u00a0but faced persecution when Sudan adopted Sharia law.(Supplied)
", "\"Part of the new laws that they brought in was forbidding anyone from having foreign currency. There were people that were found with US dollars, and they were executed.\"", "He hoped his discoveries would help repay Australia for his higher education and a life of freedom and opportunity.", "", "
Ramiz (left) with brother and two sisters in Sudan before they fled the country in 1999.(Supplied)
", "\"It's been the best thing that has happened to me; coming to Australia is.\"", "\"I found it's a place that has a very welcoming culture, has plenty of opportunities, is safe, there's freedom to do what you want, and the sky is the limit. You work hard\u00a0and you get places.\"", "Watch this story on ABC TV's Landline at 12:30pm on Sunday, or on\u00a0iview."]
